Class InputManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • InputManager

  • public class InputManager
extends java.lang.Object
    InputManager is a class that reads the file provided by the user. It also prompts the user to enter the file that is to be read.
    Since:
    March 26, 2020

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.lang.String fileToRead
      Name of the file to read
      (package private) java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> words
      An ArrayList of words in the file

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getType(java.lang.String message)
      Returns an integer of 1-3 used for the options in the menu, if the used does not enter 1-3, keeps asking the user
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getWords()
      Returns the ArrayList of words
      java.lang.String promptUserForFile()
      Prompts the user to enter the name of the file to analyze, and if the file exists reads the file and stores the words in an ArrayList, if it doesn't exist, keeps asking the user until they do enter a valid file name.
      void readFile()
      Reads the file and stores the words in an ArrayList.
      java.lang.String readSingleWord()
      Reads a single word from the user

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • fileToRead

        java.lang.String fileToRead
        Name of the file to read

      • words

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> words
        An ArrayList of words in the file

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputManager

        public InputManager()

    • Method Detail

      • promptUserForFile

        public java.lang.String promptUserForFile()
        Prompts the user to enter the name of the file to analyze, and if the file exists reads the file and stores the words in an ArrayList, if it doesn't exist, keeps asking the user until they do enter a valid file name.

      • readFile

        public void readFile()
        Reads the file and stores the words in an ArrayList. While the words are being read they are converted to lowercase, and anything but letters and numbers is removed.

      • getWords

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getWords()
        Returns the ArrayList of words
        Returns:
        ArrayList of words that have been read.

      • getType

        public int getType(java.lang.String message)
        Returns an integer of 1-3 used for the options in the menu, if the used does not enter 1-3, keeps asking the user
        Returns:
        integer value ranging from 1-3

      • readSingleWord

        public java.lang.String readSingleWord()
        Reads a single word from the user
        Returns:
        String
